title: Biden Denies US-China Ties More Strained After Balloon Incident
description: President Joe Biden denied that relations with Beijing have suffered a serious blow after the US downed an alleged Chinese spy balloon that flew across the continental US.

title: Blinken Won’t Rule Out Sending Fighter Planes to Ukraine Eventually
description: The US government continues to resist calls to provide Ukraine with fighter jets, but Secretary of State Antony Blinken stopped short of categorically ruling out such assistance down the road.

title: Yellen Still Hopes to Visit China, Says Communication Important
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said she still aims to visit China, though has no specific plans after the recent diplomatic spat over an alleged Chinese spy balloon over US airspace.

title: Trump Counsel Questions Ex-Homeland Security Chief Over Bid to Overturn Election
description: Chad Wolf, a former secretary for the Department Of Homeland Secuirty, during the America First Policy Institute's America First Agenda summit in Washington, D.C., US, on Monday, July 25, 2022. The non-profit think tank was formed last year by former cabinet members and top officials in the Trump administration to create platforms based on his policies.

title: First Australia Coal Shipment to China in 2 Years Poised to Dock
description: The first Australian coal shipment to China in more than two years is on the verge of docking, signaling hard evidence of a major thaw in trade relations between the two countries following months of diplomatic talks.

title: US Budget Deficit Widens Rapidly, Threatening Debt-Limit Timeline
description: The federal budget deficit is widening rapidly, according to the latest estimates by the Congressional Budget Office, raising the risk of the Treasury running out of cash earlier than expected amid a debt-ceiling standoff.

title: DeSantis Gets Closer to Control of Disney District After Florida House Panel Passes Bill
description: A Florida legislative committee advanced a bill that would give Republican Governor Ron DeSantis control over a special government district that’s home to Walt Disney Co., limiting the sweeping powers granted to the entertainment giant for decades.

title: Connecticut’s Lamont Pitches Two-Year Budget With Middle-Class Tax Cuts
description: Connecticut Governor Ned Lamont unveiled a $50.5 billion biennial budget that would cut income taxes on families making up to $100,000 per year, as well as have the state borrow $600 million for new housing.

title: Greek Lawmakers Move to Ban Criminals From Standing in Elections
description: Greek lawmakers approved a law late Wednesday that will prevent political parties whose leaders have been convicted of serious criminal offenses from participating in elections.

title: House Republicans Offer Cuts They’d Back in Deal for Debt Limit
description: Republicans on the House Budget Committee on Wednesday floated a list of sample budget cuts they could back in exchange for raising the nation’s debt ceiling.

title: Biden’s Top Russia Adviser Departs as Ukraine Conflict Drags On
description: President Joe Biden’s top adviser on Russia at the National Security Council is leaving his post as the US continues to grapple with the Kremlin’s war in Ukraine.

title: G-7 Weighs Sanctioning Chinese, Iranian and North Korean Firms for Aiding Russia’s Military
description: Group of Seven member states are discussing whether to sanction companies in China, Iran and North Korea they believe are providing Russia with parts and technology that have military purposes, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Biden Taunts Republican Who Heckled Him Over Their ‘Liar, Liar’ Jeers
description: President Joe Biden hit back at Republicans who heckled him during his State of the Union address over his assertion that some GOP lawmakers want to curb Social Security and Medicare benefits.

title: How Ecuador President’s Constitutional Play Backfired
description: Ecuador, one of the few countries in South America with a conservative leader, saw its politics thrown into confusion in early February when President Guillermo Lasso received a double rebuke from voters. A package of constitutional amendments he proposed was voted down, to the surprise of pollsters and investors, and the left-leaning opposition had a strong showing for mayoral races in key cities. The country’s bonds plunged at the possibility that the market-friendly Lasso won’t be able to fin

title: Trump Impeachment Veteran Debunks GOP Accusations Against Biden
description: A freshman New York Democrat used evidence he acquired as the lead attorney for Donald Trump’s first impeachment to publicly debunk accusations leveled by Republicans at President Joe Biden and his family at a Wednesday hearing.

title: China's Covid Deaths and Severe Cases Both Slide 98% From Peak Levels
description: The number of Covid-related deaths and severe cases at Chinese hospitals have both declined by 98% from peak levels reached in early January, according to the country’s Center for Disease Control and Prevention.

title: Algeria Recalls Envoy From France as New Dispute Erupts
description: French President Emmanuel Macron (L) walks with Algeria's President Abdelmadjid Tebboune (R) at Algiers airport, in Algiers, on August 27, 2022. - Emmanuel Macron was on a three-day visit to Algeria aimed at mending ties with the former French colony, which this year marks its 60th anniversary of independence. (Photo by Ludovic MARIN / AFP) (Photo by LUDOVIC MARIN/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Pakistan Says Nearing Agreement With IMF to Revive Bailout
description: Pakistan is optimistic its nearing an agreement with the International Monetary Fund to resume a $6.5 billion bailout package, a funding that will alleviate distress in a nation facing severe shortage and soaring inflation.

title: DeSantis Blasts Trump as Republicans’ 2024 Presidential Race Heats Up
description: Ron DeSantis fired back at Donald Trump for the ex-president’s intensifying broadsides against Florida’s governor as the war of words between the two potential GOP 2024 primary front-runners deepens.

title: Poland Takes Major Steps Toward Securing EU Recovery Funds
description: Poland cleared further hurdles on the way to unlock more than €35 billion ($38 billion) of the European Union’s post-pandemic aid, putting fresh financing within the ruling party’s reach just eight months before a general election.

title: Chinese Balloon Was Part of Years-Long Spying Program, US Says
description: The alleged Chinese spy balloon that transited across the US last week was part of a broader, years-long surveillance program that the US is gaining more insight into thanks to new intelligence collected about the device, a spokesman said.

title: Biden’s Big Push for Land Conservation Gets Brief Spotlight
description: The State of the Union speech included a quick mention of what’s quietly become a large part of the president’s environmental agenda.

title: Zimbabwe’s Opposition Would Win a Free And Fair Election, Survey Shows
description: Zimbabwe’s biggest opposition party would win a free and fair election, according to one of the first surveys to be released ahead of a vote expected from July this year.

title: Southwest to Describe Overwhelmed Scheduling System in Senate Hearing
description: Southwest Airlines Co.’s operations chief plans to tell US senators that the carrier’s scheduling systems became overwhelmed during a late-December storm, leading to a breakdown that forced thousands of flight cancellations and cost the company more than $1 billion.

title: Taiwan’s Pineapples Underpin Bill to Give Biden New Trade Tools
description: A bipartisan pair of senators want to give President Joe Biden a new tool in economic competition with China, allowing him to make agreements outside the normal international trade framework to counter what they term “economic coercion” by US adversaries.

title: UK Minister in Talks With US to Tackle Russian Dirty Money
description: UK Security Minister Tom Tugendhat joined US officials to discuss stepping up co-operation in tackling illicit finance from sanctioned Russians as they become more adept at evading international restrictions.

title: Twitter Access Blocked in Turkey Days After Massive Earthquakes
description: Access to Twitter in Turkey has been limited as thousands of families and rescue teams scramble to cope with the aftermath of Monday’s devastating earthquakes.

title: EU Risks Damaging Its China Relations Over Taiwan, Diplomat Says
description: The European Union risks shaking foundations of its relations with China if it continues high-profile engagement with Taiwan and pushes for a bilateral investment agreement, a senior Chinese diplomat said Wednesday.

title: Swedish Police Refuse Permit to Koran Burning at Turkey Embassy
description: Swedish police have refused to permit a Koran burning after a similar demonstration harmed its application to join NATO and sparked an outcry against the Nordic country across the Muslim world.

title: UK’s Sunak Is Assessing Possibility of Sending Jets to Ukraine
description: The UK is assessing the long-term possibility of sending fighter jets to Ukraine to help in the war against Russia, and aims to begin training Ukrainian pilots in the spring.

title: Societe Generale Gets Pulled Into SEC’s Widening Messaging Probe
description: Societe Generale SA has been drawn into the industry-wide investigation by the US Securities and Exchange Commission whether banks’ staff have made use of unauthorized communication channels.

title: Ukraine’s Zelenskiy To Arrive in Paris Tonight: AFP
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is expected to arrive in Paris on Wednesday evening, Agence France-Presse reported, citing a government source.

title: Freedom Will Win and Russia Will Lose, Zelenskiy Says
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy addresses MPs at UK Parliament in his first visit since his country was invaded by Russia. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Former UK PM Boris Johnson Records £2.5 Million Advance for Speaking Gigs
description: The former premier ranks among the highest-earning parliamentarians since leaving office.

title: Erdogan Vows Building Blitz to Renew Quake-Hit Areas Within Year
description: Turkey’s President Recep Tayyip Erdogan promised to rebuild areas hit by two deadly earthquakes within a year as he toured one of the worst-stricken towns on Wednesday.

title: Scholz Says Russia Faces New EU Sanctions on War’s One-Year Mark
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said the European Union will impose a new round of sanctions against Russia this month to mark the one-year anniversary of President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: To Fend Off Attack Over Adani Links, Modi Recounts Past Scams
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi avoided any direct mention of the Adani Group’s tussle with a US short seller and a subsequent rout in its market value, instead lashing out at corruption within the opposition and highlighting the South Asian nation’s economic success during his tenure.

title: Chile’s Inflation Tops All Forecasts in Fresh Test for the Central Bank
description: Consumer prices in January rise 0.8% on month, 12.3% compared to a year ago

title: Germany Pressures EU Allies to Send Leopard 2 Tanks to Ukraine
description: Germany is increasingly concerned that its European allies will not provide Ukraine with enough Leopard 2 battle tanks to create two battalions, with an escalation in fighting predicted in the coming months.

title: Turkish Quakes Complicate Road to Elections
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan wants to have general elections three months from now, but the devastation from this week’s two massive earthquakes may be too great for him to ignore.

title: House GOP Opens Hunter Biden Probe, Focusing on What Twitter Did
description: House Republicans plan to grill former Twitter Inc. executives over their alleged cooperation with the FBI to squelch the story of Hunter Biden’s laptop, the opening salvo in their probe into the Biden family finances.

title: Farmers Roll Hundreds of Tractors to Paris to Protest Pesticide Ban
description: French farmers drove hundreds of tractors to Paris to protest a European ban on controversial pesticides that threatens sugar output, as well as other agricultural regulations.

title: Northern Ireland Protocol Is Lawful, UK Top Court Rules
description: The Northern Ireland Protocol is valid and drawn up in line with UK legislation, the Supreme Court ruled on Wednesday in a boost to Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s embattled government.

title: Three Climate Takeaways From Biden’s Second State of the Union
description: “Let’s face reality. The climate crisis doesn’t care if you’re in a red or blue state,” the president told members of Congress.

title: Xi Told Japan’s Abe He Wouldn’t Be a Communist If Born in the US
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping told the late Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe he probably wouldn’t have joined the Communist Party if he’d been born in the US, but would have been a member of the Democratic or Republican parties.

title: Ukraine President Zelenskiy to Arrive in London on UK Visit
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will visit the UK on Wednesday to meet Rishi Sunak and visit Ukrainian troops, the prime minister’s office said.

title: Erdogan Wants Elections in May Despite Earthquake Fallout
description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is working on the assumption general elections will be held in Turkey three months from now despite twin earthquakes devastating much of the southeast this week.

title: Putin Is Playing for Time on Ukraine, Estonian Spy Agency Says
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin remains convinced time is on his side as he presses forward with the invasion of Ukraine, with plenty of resources at his disposal to feed his war machine, according to Estonian intelligence.

title: China Says US Should Return Debris From Balloon It Shot Down
description: A prominent Chinese diplomat said the US should return debris from the balloon it shot down because it is the Asian nation’s property, putting the decision over the aircraft’s remains in Washington’s hands.

title: Russia, Western Envoys Offer Dueling Visions for Africa in Sudan
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and envoys from the US and Europe have converged on Sudan simultaneously as the Kremlin and its Western opponents step up competition in Africa against the backdrop of the war in Ukraine.

title: South Korea Partisan Rift Widens With Vote to Impeach Minister
description: South Korea’s progressive opposition bloc used its majority in parliament to approve an unprecedented impeachment measure against the interior minister, heating up partisan tensions as worries mount about the country falling into recession.

title: Five Nuclear Powers Held Talks in Dubai in February: Kommersant
description: Five global nuclear powers held a two-day meeting in Dubai early this month to discuss nuclear non-proliferation issues, Russian newspaper Kommersant reported, citing unidentified officials.

title: Ukraine Latest: Biden Calls Putin’s War a ‘Test for the Ages’
description: President Joe Biden said in his State of the Union address that Russian President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine “has been a test for the ages, a test for America, a test for the world,” adding that the US and its allies had risen to the challenge.

title: Taliban Tighten Currency Controls After Dollar Smuggling Report
description: The Taliban imposed fresh restrictions on people carrying foreign currency out of Afghanistan via a rare directive from the prime minister’s office after a report that millions of dollars were being smuggled in each day from Pakistan, shoring up its battered economy.

title: New Zealand police find 3.5 tons of cocaine in Pacific Ocean
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand (AP) — New Zealand police said Wednesday they found more than 3 tons of cocaine floating in a remote part of the Pacific Ocean after it was dropped there by an international drug-smuggling syndicate.

title: Sarah Sanders Urges Republicans to Fight Biden’s ‘Woke Mob’
description: Arkansas Governor Sarah Huckabee Sanders said Americans are “under attack in a left-wing culture war” in the Republican response to the State of the Union on Tuesday, drawing on themes pushed by Donald Trump in his third run for the White House.

title: Quake Latest: Turkish Army in Rescue Operations; Oil Flows Begin
description: Turkey began deploying thousands of soldiers in areas struck by two massive earthquakes, following President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s announcement of a three-month state of emergency.

title: Biden Wants to Ban ‘Junk Fees.’ Here’s What That Means
description: Hidden extra charges in concert tickets and hotel rates draw the President’s ire in State of the Union speech.

title: Biden Baits Republicans With Unity Pleas That Provoke Catcalls
description: President Joe Biden used his State of the Union address Tuesday evening to lay a trap, and House Republicans couldn’t help but walk into it.

title: Britain’s Public Service Crisis Looms as a Defining Election Issue
description: Strikes are shining a spotlight on the country’s neglected health and transport infrastructure.

title: Sweden Eyes Stockpiling of Raw Materials as Part of EU Plan
description: Europe should consider stockpiling key minerals as part of its plan to reduce its strategic dependency on critical raw materials from outside the bloc, a top Swedish official said.

title: Kishida Indicates Not Wanting to Surprise Market With BOJ Choice
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said that he will carefully consider the market impact while choosing a new Bank of Japan governor, indicating little intention to signal an immediate shift at the bank with a surprise decision.

title: Here Are the Key Takeaways From Biden’s State of the Union Speech
description: President Joe Biden’s address to Congress foreshadowed his 2024 stump speech, if as expected he runs for a second term — but at times it was almost drowned out by the Republican heckling.

title: Biden Goes Off-Script to Concede Oil Demand Will Last for Years
description: President Joe Biden went off-script during an otherwise climate-friendly State of the Union speech Tuesday night to state an uncomfortable reality for the White House: “We’re still going to need oil and gas for a while.”

title: Biden Highlights Threats to Democracy in State of the Union
description: President Joe Biden highlighted ongoing threats to free and fair elections in his State of the Union address to Congress, linking the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol to the assault last fall on then-Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s husband.

title: New Zealand PM Unwinds Ardern Policies After Two Weeks in Job
description: New Zealand Prime Minister Chris Hipkins has stepped back from some of his predecessor Jacinda Ardern’s more unpopular policies as he refocuses on combating soaring prices and seizing the political middle ground ahead of October’s election.

title: Jokowi Threatens to Fire Police if Haze Engulfs Indonesia Again
description: President Joko Widodo warned the police to stop large fires from engulfing the country as the threat of El Nino — a dry weather pattern — looms across Indonesia.

title: Biden Calls on Congress to ‘Finish the Job on Police Reform’
description: President Joe Biden urged Congress Tuesday to “come together and finish the job on police reform,” in the wake of the killing of Tyre Nichols, a Black man who died after a fatal beating by Memphis, Tennessee, police officers.

title: Biden Calls Putin’s Invasion of Ukraine a ‘Test for the Ages’
description: President Joe Biden said Russian President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine was a test that the US and its NATO allies had passed, and vowed again to stand with President Volodymyr Zelenskiy as long as needed.

title: Republicans Call Biden ‘Liar’ in Off-Script Tussle Over Medicare
description: If President Joe Biden was trying to agitate Republicans over cutting Social Security and Medicare, it worked.

title: Malaysia Unity Government Allies to Face State Polls Together
description: Malaysia Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said all parties in his unity government will work together in the state elections, a sign of further support for Anwar who solidified power with a confidence vote victory in December.

title: Biden Seeks Passage of Pared-Down Border Security, Dreamers Bill
description: President Joe Biden will urge lawmakers to pass a pared-down package of changes to immigration law, as his administration continues to grapple with historic numbers of apprehensions at the southwest US border.

title: Biden Calls for Antitrust Measures to Rein in Power of Big Tech
description: President Joe Biden called for antitrust legislation targeting technology giants, putting a spotlight on companies including Amazon.com Inc, Apple Inc., Meta Platforms Inc. and Alphabet Inc.’s Google.

title: Biden Vows to Protect US Against Chinese Threats to Sovereignty
description: President Joe Biden said the US would cooperate with China where it can but protect its sovereignty “as we made clear last week,” an indirect reference to the uproar over the alleged Chinese spy balloon that transited US territory before it was shot down.

title: Japan PM to Ratchet Up Wage Hike Push With Business, Labor Talks
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is set to increase pressure for pay increases by reviving three-way talks among the government, business leaders and labor unions that have been dormant for almost eight years.

title: Read Biden’s Full State of the Union Speech
description: These are his remarks as prepared.

title: Xi Calls For China’s Modernization Path to Surpass Capitalism
description: China must work to create a path to modernization that is more efficient than capitalism and better safeguards social justice, President Xi Jinping told top officials.

title: George Santos Is Ready for His Close Up at His First State of the Union
description: Embattled Representative George Santos is well-placed to shake President Joe Biden’s hand at the State of the Union address, having shown up early to save a coveted aisle seat.

title: Malaysia Weighs Trade Curbs to Fight EU’s Anti-Palm Oil Policies
description: Malaysia, the world’s second-biggest palm oil producer, is weighing a range of trade curbs to strike back against what it calls unfair policies from the European Union that block market access for the tropical oil.

title: Sri Lanka’s President Seeks to Reunite, Revive Bankrupt Nation
description: Sri Lanka’s president Ranil Wickremesinghe is expected to lay out a vision for recovery for the bankrupt nation and call for unity as the country is pushed to take difficult measures to win an International Monetary Fund loan to address the worst economic crisis in its independent history.

title: North Korea Readies Military Parade as Kim Boosts Nuclear Arms
description: North Korea appears to be staging its first military parade in almost a year, providing leader Kim Jong Un a platform to show off his latest weapons after threatening to exponential expand his nuclear arms programs.

title: UK Lawmakers Attack HSBC’s Treatment of Hong Kong Immigrants
description: A committee of UK lawmakers criticized HSBC Holdings Plc’s treatment of Hong Kong customers who have found it impossible to access their savings after moving to Britain.
